resources.string:
Purpose of this app is to facilitate a communication between two operators in a short range(depending upon the visibility of flashlight) specially when their is no cellular network available. 

Mainstream cypher language Morse is used for transmitting text information. 

An easy to use Morse Decoder is also provided so that unskilled observer can also decrypt the message. 

Morse decoder is robust algorithm and it can manipulate human error to some extent.

1. Morse code is a method of transmitting text information as a series of on-off tones, lights, or clicks. 
2. The Morse Code encodes the alphanumeric as sequences of short and long signals called "dots" and "dashes". 
3. All Morse code elements depend on the dot length. 
4. Since there no standard transmission speed is defined, it can be changed as preferred.

1. Morse code transmission speed can be changed in settings. 
2. Facility of sending a short signal to let other user know when to start or stop is provided. 
3. For decoding, one have to simulate incoming message to button pressed. 
4. Learn more from the tutorial in settings.

1. Press 'Start' to simulate the message. 
2. Press 'Next' to change message. 
3. Press & hold receiver circle when you see an incoming flashlight message. 
4. Repeat step 3 until you see 'Done'. 
5. Use 'Decode' to decrypt the message.
